abstracts.cdata!:
The Sugar Project consists of: (a) the
            major rehabilitation, over four years, of three designated
            sugar factories at Sragi (Central Java), Pesantren and
            Gempolkrep (East Java); (b) the minor rehabilitation, over
            five years, of about six sugar factories in Java, and
            preparation of six others for subsequent implementation; the
            final selection of these factories will be made by agreement
            with the Association; (c) associated agricultural and cane
            transportation improvements; (d) extension services and
            credit for cane farmers; and (e) consultant services to
            provide management, training and engineering assistance to
            the Government sugar enterprises, strengthen the appraisal
            capability of the Bank Bumi Daya (BBD), the State Bank
            responsible for assisting agro-industries and estate
            agriculture, provide research services to the Pasuruan
            Research Station and to carry out feasibility studies and
            prepare a program for additional sugar production in Indonesia.

The Sugar Project consists of: (a) the
